page.title: 04Cottages and Farmhouses
page.content: The houses in this area can be described as old cottages and farmhouses built of local granite.Two houses,Wray Barton and Doccombe Mill were registered in the first Domesday Book.There is no new housing in the area,but a few agricultural barns have been converted into dwellings, for private homes and holiday accommod_ ation. There are farm complexes, isolated cottages and a group of fifteen houses on either side of the B3212 known as Doccombe.The houses are privately owned execpt for two cottages owned by the South West Water Authority. All properties are served by mains electricity and have their own spring water and sceptic tanks. There are a number of ruined farm houses forcibly abandoned for fear of polution of the reservoirs.
